files.name: main.py
files.description:
Single-file solution for the entire project. Implement any necessary helper functions and numerical routines directly in this file. Running this script must:
- Execute all experiments described in project_plan['experiments'].
- Generate all requested plots using matplotlib, saving them with the exact filenames specified in the experiment plan.
- Compute and (optionally) print any requested metrics.
- Finally, print the primary numeric answer on a line of the form:
    print('Answer:', value)
No additional modules or files are required; keep everything in this one script.

files.name: environment.yaml
files.description: Conda environment specification required to run main.py. Use a valid YAML conda env format with a name, channels, and dependencies. Include a pinned Python version and only the libraries that are actually imported in main.py (e.g., numpy, matplotlib, etc.).

experiments.name: Time response for different damping regimes
experiments.goal: Compare displacement vs time for underdamped, critically damped, and overdamped cases.
experiments.description: Simulate the second‑order ODE m·x'' + c·x' + k·x = 0 for three damping ratios (ζ < 1, ζ = 1, ζ > 1) using the same initial displacement and zero initial velocity. Plot the displacement over time on a single figure to illustrate the characteristic behaviors.

plots.description: Displacement versus time for underdamped, critically damped, and overdamped oscillators.

experiments.name: Phase‑space trajectories vs damping
experiments.goal: Visualize how damping affects the trajectory in the (position, velocity) plane.
experiments.description: For the same three damping ratios as in exp1, integrate the system and record position and velocity. Plot each trajectory in phase space on a single plot, using arrows or a colormap to indicate time progression.

plots.description: Phase‑space (position vs velocity) curves for the three damping regimes.
